meanings.definition: An organization or group that opposes or acts in opposition to established institutions.
meanings.sent1: The local community center became a counterinstitution by advocating for change in the city council.
meanings.sent2: The new political party was formed as a counterinstitution to challenge the existing government.
meanings.sent3: The counterinstitution of young activists brought a fresh perspective to the debate.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of ideas, the counterinstitution emerged as a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: The grassroots movement grew into a powerful counterinstitution over time.

meanings.definition: A system or structure that functions in opposition to traditional institutions.
meanings.sent1: The alternative school provided a counterinstitution to the traditional education system.
meanings.sent2: The online platform offered a digital counterinstitution to brick-and-mortar stores.
meanings.sent3: The quirky bookstore served as a charming counterinstitution to the big chain retailers.
meanings.sent4: The decentralized network acted as a resilient counterinstitution in times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The community garden served as a peaceful counterinstitution to urban development.

meanings.definition: A movement or entity that serves as a counterbalance to existing institutions.
meanings.sent1: The environmental group acted as a counterinstitution to the industrial polluters.
meanings.sent2: The consumer rights organization functioned as a necessary counterinstitution to corporate greed.
meanings.sent3: The music festival provided a fun counterinstitution to the usual cultural events.
meanings.sent4: The youth council served as a dynamic counterinstitution to the established city council.
meanings.sent5: The community choir acted as a harmonious counterinstitution to the bustling city life.
